If you are running the JUnit tests through ANT you can do all kinds of
things like play a sound, pop up an image, send an email, etc.

	
	
	----- Original Message -----
	From: <SP-yahoo.com@...>
	To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
	Sent: Tuesday, January 14, 2003 1:02 AM
	Subject: [junit] Notification
	
	
	> Is there any built in possibility in junit (or in the swing
	> testrunner) to notify the user as soon as
	>
	> a) there's an error or failure
	> or
	> b) all tests have finished
	>
	> or at least an event for which I could define the action to
take in
	> these cases?
	>
	> While our complete tests are running (takes about 600-700 sec)
I want
	> to do something different but I don't want to loose time when
they
	> have finished or if there is an error. So it would be
sufficient if
	> there were a loud and clear "beep".
	>
	> Thanks,
	>
	> Markus
	>
	>
	>
